attributes.action: abolish plans to reform council tax, whereby inspectors have the power to enter homes to assess improvements made to it, so that a higher rate of council tax can be charged
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Council tax has traditionally been a charge on the amount of services (e.g. waste collection, policing, street lighting etc)used by a householder. Why therefore, does the fact that your home has been extended and/or improved mean that you are going to consume more of these services? 

This is just another example of this Government taxing us by the back door. What is even more sinister is the fact that inspectors are to have the power to enter our homes with cameras and videos to assess the improvements we have made. Further, what relevance does the inside of our house have to the amount of services we consume? When will this Government stop penalising hard work and effort.

rejection.details: This petition overlaps with several already in existence - http://petitions.pm.gov.uk/BANCOUNCILTAX/
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
